blocks.name: ismrer1
blocks.content: An isometry between ` RR ` and ` RR ^ 1 ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)

  eqtrd(cfv(csqrt, csu(hs2, csn(c0), co(co(cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), cmin, cfv(cfv(c2, cv(hs1)), cv(hs2))), cexp, nat2))), cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(hs1))), cfv(csqrt, co(cfv(cabs, co(cv(hs0), cmin, cv(hs1))), cexp, nat2)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wcel(cv(hs1), cr))))

blocks.name: reheibor
blocks.content: Heine-Borel theorem for real numbers. A subset of ` RR ` is compact iff it is closed and bounded. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: iccbnd
blocks.content: A closed interval in ` RR ` is bounded. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: A closed interval in ` RR ` is compact. Alternate proof of ~ icccmp using the Heine-Borel theorem ~ heibor . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 14-Aug-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm icccmpALT(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(c2, ccmp))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c0, cicc, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c3, c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmopn, c4))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(c2, ccmp), wcel(c3, cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))), wcel(c4, cfv(cbnd, c3)))
  syl5eqel(c3, cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), co(c0, cicc, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  icccld(c0, c1)
  iccbnd(c0, c1, c4, c3)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wb(wcel(c2, ccmp), wa(wcel(c3, cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))), wcel(c4, cfv(cbnd, c3)))), wss(c3, cr))
  syl5eqss(c3, cr, co(c0, cicc, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  iccssre(c0, c1)
  reheibor(c3, c2, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), c4)
  eqid(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
}
